item.title: [GROOVY-10920] Compiler exception with void expression as while condition with CompileStatic
item.description:
Under static compilation, using a void expression as the condition (or part of the condition) of a while statement causes the compiler to throw exceptions.

This code:

package example

import groovy.transform.CompileStatic

@CompileStatic
class WhileVoid {
	void isSo() {
		null
	}

	void myBuggyConstruct() {
		while(isSo()) {
			null
		}
	}
}

This example, with a slightly more complex condition for the while loop:

package example

import groovy.transform.CompileStatic

@CompileStatic
class WhileNotVoid {
	List list = []

	void isSo() {
		null
	}

	void myBuggyConstruct() {
		while(!list.empty && !isSo()) {
			null
		}
	}
}

results in a different compiler exception:

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This affects 3.0 back to at least 3.0.8 and 2.5 back to at least 2.5.14.
